11.text: In the bowels of the earth

13.text: live creatures perfectly adapted to life in perpetual darkness.

21.text: Bats’ extraordinary ability of to navigate through echolocation

25.text: allows them to move at incredible speed,

31.text: detecting and giving chase to insects in flight.

47.text: sometimes forming groups made up of different species.

58.text: These massive crowds are true communal nurseries.

68.text: Such density of numbers helps to maintain body heat,

71.text: but it also encourages the spread of external parasites.

74.text: Fleas and mites in their millions feed on the blood of those

79.text: who in turn feed on larger insects.

93.text: plays a crucial role in the control of insect populations.

102.text: At dusk, the adults share the commune’s tasks:

105.text: some remain to look after the nursery,

107.text: while most disperse along the riverbanks

110.text: to hunt mosquitoes, moths and beetles.
